{{cpp/chrono/title|year_month_day_last}}
{{cpp/chrono/year_month_day_last/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=chrono|since=c++20|
class year_month_day_last;
}}
The class {{tt|year_month_day_last}} represents the last day of a specific year and month. It is a field-based time point, with a resolution of {{lc|std::chrono::days}}, subject to the limit that it can only represent the last day of a month.

{{lc|std::chrono::years}}- and {{lc|std::chrono::months}}-oriented arithmetic are supported directly. An implicit conversion to {{lc|std::chrono::sys_days}} allows {{lc|std::chrono::days}}-oriented arithmetic to be performed efficiently.

{{tt|year_month_day_last}} is a {{named req|TriviallyCopyable}} {{named req|StandardLayoutType}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;chrono&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    const auto ymd = std::chrono::year_month_day
    {
        std::chrono::floor&lt;std::chrono::days&gt;(std::chrono::system_clock::now())
    };
    
    const std::chrono::year_month_day_last ymdl
    {
        ymd.year(), ymd.month() / std::chrono::last
    };
    
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "The last day of present month (" &lt;&lt; ymdl &lt;&lt; ") is: "
              &lt;&lt; std::chrono::year_month_day{ymdl}.day() &lt;&lt; '\n';
    
    // The 'last' object can be placed wherever it is legal to place a 'day':
    using namespace std::chrono;
    constexpr std::chrono::year_month_day_last
        ymdl1 = 2023y / February / last,
        ymdl2 = last / February / 2023y,
        ymdl3 = February / last / 2023y;
    static_assert(ymdl1 == ymdl2 &amp;&amp; ymdl2 == ymdl3);
}
|p=true
|output=
The last day of present month (2023/Aug/last) is: 31
}}
